title: 114_hr2525
content:
The Act is titled the "Hero Street USA Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings. Congress finds that in 1968, 2nd Street of Silvis, Illinois, was renamed Hero Street to honor the sacrifice and patriotism of its residents, many of whom were Mexican families who settled there in the 1920s and 1930s for work with the local railroad. The young men of Hero Street served in World War II and the Korean Conflict, with a strong tradition of military service continuing in the community. Today, over 100 men and women from Hero Street have served in the military. In 1968, 2nd Street of Silvis, Illinois was renamed Hero Street to honor Mexican families who settled there in the 1920s and 1930s for work with the local railroad. Over 100 men and women from Hero Street have served in the military, with a concentration higher than any other street comparable in size. A park and monument in Silvis honor the 8 deceased service members and all who have served in the United States Military. 2018 will mark the 50th anniversary of Hero Street's renaming. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative coins for the semi centennial of Hero Street:
- $5 gold coins: 50,000 coins, 8.359 grams, 0.850 inches diameter, 90% gold
- $1 silver coins: 400,000 coins, 26.73 grams, 1.500 inches diameter, at least 90% silver
- Half-dollar clad coins: 750,000 coins, 11.34 grams, 1.205 inches diameter The coins minted under this Act for the semi centennial of Hero Street will have a diameter of 1.205 inches and be legal tender. They will also be considered numismatic items. The coins minted under this Act will have a design emblematic of Hero Street USA, with inscriptions of the coin value, year "2018", and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS.

Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities. Only 1 facility of the United States Mint may be used to strike any particular quality of coin under this Act. The Secretary may issue coins under this Act only during the period beginning on January 1, 2018, and ending on December 31, 2018.

SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coin, the surcharge provided in section 7(a), and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be made at a reasonable discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES.

Sales of coins under this Act will include surcharges of $35 for the $5 coin, $10 for the $1 coin, and $5 for the half-dollar coin. Surcharges received will be paid to the Wounded Warrior Project. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure that minting coins under this Act will not cost the Federal Government. No funds will be disbursed until the total cost of designing and issuing all coins is recovered by the United States Treasury.
